short_summary: Implementation of an Engagement Strategy to Capture Lived Experiences of Individuals from Equity-Deserving Groups
description: The Skills and Employment Branch (SEB) at Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) requires services of a Contractor to engage with target population and report findings on research questions. the findings will inform the development and implementation of SEB policies and programs to make skills and employment programs more accessible, inclusive and responsive to the different labour market needs of individuals.

full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Implementation of an Engagement Strategy to Capture Lived Experiences of Individuals from Equity-Deserving Groups in Canada

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Solicitation Number:** 100022280
**Reference:** PW-22-01013684
**Publication Date:** 2022-11-16
**Tender Closing Date:** 2022-12-12T10:00:00 EDT (expired)
**Contracting Entity:** Employment and Social Development Canada

**Objective:**
Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) is seeking a contractor to engage with individuals from equity-deserving groups and capture their lived experiences related to ESDC's skills and employment programs. The contractor will review ESDC's program evaluation reports, engage with the target population, and provide findings to inform policy and program development.

**Target Population:**
Individuals from equity-deserving groups who meet at least one of the following criteria:
* Received Employment Insurance (EI) benefits and used Job Bank within the last 3 years to find a job
* Were unemployed within the past 3 years and used Job Bank to find a job
* Were employed within the past 3 years and used Job Bank to find another job

**Scope of Work:**
1. Conduct a review of ESDC's skills and employment program evaluation reports and relevant literature based on research questions
2. Engage with the target population to gather their experiences and provide findings to inform policy and program development

**Contract Period:**
The proposed contract period is from the contract start date to February 29, 2024.

**Eligibility:**
Bidders must be registered on the Government of Canada's procurement website, Canada Buys.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The evaluation of proposals will be based on the following criteria: qualifications, past experience, methodology, and technical approach.

**Contact Information:**
For more information, please contact Yves Cormier at yves.cormier@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca.

**Attachments:**
The tender document and other relevant information can be found on the Government of Canada's procurement website, Canada Buys. [1 english document][1 french document]

Please note that the tender closing date has expired. This announcement is for information purposes only. [Back to Canada Buys Homepage](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders) 

Note: I kept the same title format as the original text, as it resembles a common government document format
